value.0: I don't talk with weak trash maybe if you prove yourself in the heat of battle then we can talk.

We are Black Spiral Dancers.  We were born from the hubris of a dead Tribe that thought to challenge the Wyrm in its own lands, far beyond light and hope.  The few that survived returned with Its Mark, Its Gifts.  The Others call us corrupted, twisted, insane.  Ask the White Howlers if it is so.  One cannot walk the darkest paths of the underworld without understanding the truth.  The Wyrm is the only true Path and Power.  All else is lie and delusion.  They will learn in time.  As with the Howlers, all of the Tribes will be shattered and processed.  The Weaver will be broken and the Wyld consumed in the dark fires of the Wyrm.  In the end, all that will remain is the Wyrm and the Dancers of Its Dark Spiral.
Be sure to know your liteny mutt.
Well which part do I tell you about. I wont have you endangering my Hive.

This is a highly important part of the Black Spirals' Litany.  The Pit is the only place where they are safe from their enemies.  Because of this, they have managed to maintain secrecy of their tunnel systems.  If anyone other than a Black Spiral intrudes into a Pit, that one is hunted until dead.  Not even prisoners of the Black Spirals are ever taken into their Pits, and no word is ever spoken about a Pit when outside the Pit itself.

The Black Spirals have maintained this for the same reason they have maintained the previous part of the Litany.  Hoverver, the circumstances which constitute "war" or "peace" are never very clear since the Black Spirals are almost always involved in some sort of conflict.  Usually, challenges to leaders can be made any time there is not an actual battle being fought or getting ready to be fought.

This is an important holdover from the Litany of all the tribes.  This is because the system of pack and Hive governance is the same for Black Spirals as pack and sept governance for the other tribes.  It has been an effective system for centuries.

This is as important to the Black Spirals as it is to other Garou.  Unlike some of the other tribes, the Black Spirals uphold this one fully.  If a Garou refuses to allow herself to be ripped apart by her fellow Garou, her Hive-mates can take it upon themselves to kill her anyway, even if she tries to resist.

The Black Spiral Dancers understand the need for the Veil as much as the other Tribes do.  In addition, it is also important for them to hide themselves from their enemies among the Garou.  They prefer to remain unseen, allowing them the advantage of surprise.
While the Black Spirals want revenge on all other Garou, they will accept all members of other tribes who turn their backs on their people and join the service of the Wyrm.

The Black Spirals often try to impress their prisoners into taking their Rite of Passage, allowing them to be embraced by the Wyrm.  Prisoners who balk are put to death.  The Black Spirals can do nothing with prisoners, as they are so outnumbered; they must either permanently remove opponents or make them allies.

This passage goes hand in hand with the previous part of the Litany.  This prevents a Hive from taking any action against a member of another Hive who passes through its tunnels.  To do so would breach the Litany, which is taken in dedly seriousness. If a Black Spiral is harmed in any way when he did nothing to deserve it, he may expect compensation.

This is a very important part of the Litany.  It allows Hives to remain secure that no other Hives are moving into the area to live.  This has yet to be a problem, since new Hives that have just been formed have always taken over the Caerns of other Garou, and we are alone on this little island.  This part of the Litany is part of the etiquette used in traveling through the Pit tunnel systems.  It allows a Black Spiral to travel through another Hive's tunnels so long as no harm is done to them.  If harm is done, then the Hive may take full retribution.

This is the basis for Black Spiral unity and our tribe's allegiances with vampires or others.  The tribe will only support you as long as you're serving the Wyrm, NOT yourself.  This has led to disputes over what is good and appropriate service, sometimes inciting inter-Hive feuds and I WON'T have it in MY hive got it!
Without a doubt!
I know it leave me alone!
I don't have a clue.
Ye shall take no action that causes a Pit to be violated
Ok
The leader shall not be challenged in time of war
Ok
The leader may be challenged at any time in peace
Ok
Do not suffer thy people to tend to thy sickness in death
Ok
The Veil shall not be lifted
Ok
Respect all who serve the Wyrm
Ok
Slay those who will not join you
Ok
Give safe passage to those of other Hives
Ok
Beware the territory of another
Ok
Serve the Wyrm in all its forms
Ok
